All right. So, for my final project, I
made an app that rounds up any purchase
and puts whatever was rounded up into a
savings account. Uh, I did this by using
an AI
app builder called base 44 and also I
used some API keys as well. Uh so
for the sake of this video, you can you
can link up your card and like actually
put your account in, but for this uh
sake of the video, I'm going to just I
added a simulate purchases. So I'm not
using my actual bank account and sharing
that information. Um in the settings,
you can choose which account you want it
to be connected to. Then you can do a
multiplier. So, if you want to do two
times of the roundup, so instead of you
spend 75 cents, it would go to 50 cents.
Um, you can also put a weekly limit on
the roundup amount. That way, you're not
taking too much extra money in. And you
can also pause it and get notifications
as well. Over here, you got we're going
to start with total saved. So, it'll
tell you how much has been saved by
taking that extra money that's been
rounded up and putting it into a savings
account. We show you the weekly stats
and then your goals. And you can put
custom goals. Right now I have summer
vacation, emergency fund, and new
MacBook. And then I'll do a simulate
purchase. So you can kind of see, let's
say I went to Whole Foods, got
food and drink, and I spent $4530.
Um, since that's 70 would 70 cents would
be rounding up. It's going to put a $140
into the savings account. So, you can
see that that went up by $140 and that
went up by $140 this week. And then
it'll also track your recent roundups.
And by doing this, it'll help you save
up for each of these goals. And that's
important because a lot of college
students have trouble saving up for
certain goals. And this is kind of a way
to do it without actively thinking. and
you're also still spending money, but
you're still saving. And then down here,
there's also an AI and analysis that'll
kind of analyze your financial
purchases. So, it'll tell you your food
spending. You spent a significant amount
of food, particularly at Whole Foods and
Starbucks. So, it tells you consider
reducing these visits. Um, you might
want to boost your emergency fund
progress and then also celebrate your
achievements.
So, this is just another way for the
students who are using this app to
really understand what it's doing and
give them some personalized tips for
their savings. So, yeah, this is the appI created. Thank you.
